hero.title: Unsupervised Learning for Heart Rate Anomaly Detection
hero.subtitle: This Master's Independent Study has concluded. The research compared 7 machine learning models to detect physiological anomalies in runners under real-world 'cold-start' conditions.

performanceSection.title: Model Performance Analysis
performanceSection.subtitle: Quantitative Results (Fixed-Parameter Test)
performanceSection.description: The study simulated a 'Cold-Start' scenario where models could not be tuned for individual users. Under these strict conditions, Shape-based models outperformed Deep Learning.
performanceSection.note: *Scores represent F0.5-Score (emphasizing Precision) averaged across all subjects.

cards.title: Robustness of Shape
cards.content: Matrix Profile proved the most robust. By analyzing the 'shape' of heart rate patterns rather than just statistical values, it could detect anomalies without prior user data.

cards.title: The 'Cold-Start' Trap
cards.content: Deep Learning models (USAD, LSTM-AE) failed significantly in the cold-start phase. They require personalized tuning and large datasets to function effectively.

cards.title: Individual Variability
cards.content: The study confirmed that a 'One-Size-Fits-All' threshold is impossible. Physiological data varies too much between individuals for static rules to work.

techStack.title: System Architecture
techStack.description: A full-stack solution was developed to collect and annotate the Ground Truth dataset.

hero.subtitle: The Research
hero.title: About the Study
hero.description: This study focused on analyzing heart rate patterns during running using Unsupervised Machine Learning techniques to detect potential anomalies that may indicate cardiovascular risks.

objectives.title: Project Objectives
list: To develop an effective unsupervised machine learning model for detecting heart rate anomalies.
To compare Classical ML vs. Deep Learning performance under fixed-parameter constraints.
To create a high-quality, expert-annotated ground truth dataset for physiological anomalies.

methodology.title: Methodology & Technology
methodology.description: The research compared 7 algorithms divided into Classical ML and Standard Deep Learning. Performance was evaluated using F0.5-Score to prioritize precision.

faq.a: The study found that Matrix Profile was the most effective model for detecting anomalies without prior training on specific user data.
All data has been used for the analysis presented in the completed independent study. As per the IRB agreement, all personal identifiers remain anonymized and data is securely stored.
